intro: Cissampelos elata, commonly known as the arrowhead vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and twining stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by orange-red berries that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
